Column Comment.0: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.1: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.2: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.3: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.4: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.5: ABBREVIATION: Abbreviation used for reference type or code.
Column Comment.6: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.7: ALIAS LONG NAME: Full or long name for the alias version.
Column Comment.8: ALIAS REASON: The reason why the alias was created, such as governmentchange, assigned by application etc.
Column Comment.9: SHORT NAME: A short name given to an alias.
Column Comment.10: STRATIGRAPHIC ALIAS TYPE: The type of stratigraphic alias, such as working,vendor, regulatory etc.
Column Comment.11: AMENDED DATE: the date on which a name has been ammended. Often, this isused for official or legal changes to a name.
Column Comment.12: CREATED DATE: The date on which the alias was first created. This date maypreceed the ammendment date, in the event that the ammended date refers to aformal registration event.
Column Comment.13: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.14: EXPIRY DATE: the date that the alias was no longer recognised as such.
Column Comment.15: LANGUAGE IDENTIFIER: The language of the alias.
Column Comment.16: ORIGINAL INDICATOR: A y/n flag indicating that this alias is the original one firstassigned to a business object.
Column Comment.17: ALIAS OWNER BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: unique identifier for the business associatewho owns this alias.
Column Comment.18: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.19: PREFERRED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this alias is a preferredname or code.
Column Comment.20: REASON DESCRIPTION: A narrative explanation about the alias being used.
Column Comment.21: REMARK: narrative remarks about the stratigraphic alias
Column Comment.22: SOURCE DOCUMENT: References the document where this alias has been given.Documents may be published, internal references, journals etc.
Column Comment.23: STRUCK OFF DATE: Date on which the legal name was struck from corporateregistry and is no longer used.
Column Comment.24: SOFTWARE APPLICATION IDENTIFIER: The identifier for the application that ownsthis alias or code or that is used to apply the data in this row.
Column Comment.25: USE RULE: A narrative column that is used to describe the circumstances in whichthis alias is to be used.
Column Comment.26: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.27: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.28: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.29: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.30: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.31: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.32: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
